{"label":"Synch Speakers","category":"DataFlow_Component","size":"240 80","color":"LightSeaGreen","in_":[{"portId":"in","name":"in"},{"portId":"doStart","name":"doStart"},{"portId":"doStop","name":"doStop"}],"out_":[{"portId":"out","name":"out"}],"props_":[{"name":"computeBarrier","value":"*"},{"name":"isLogOn","value":"false","unit":"","valueChanged":true}],"isFile":true,"fileContent":"var nodeData, name, value;

const isLogOn = graphData.dfe.get( nodeData, 'isLogOn', false );

// This component make the following task
// 1) receive a sentence from an agent
// 2) send it to the chat and to the TTS
// 3) it it receive another sentence while the current sentence is still speaking
//    then it waits to send until the TTS end the current speack
if( name == 'in') {
  log( 'INPUT FROM '+value.sender );
  graphData.dfe.set( nodeData, 'message', value );
  
} else if( name == 'doStart' ) {
  let message = graphData.dfe.get( nodeData, 'message', null );
  if( !message ) {
    message = { sender: 'Others' };
    graphData.dfe.set( nodeData, 'message', message );
  }
  
  log( 'DO START '+message.sender );
  
  const isSpeaking = graphData.dfe.get( nodeData, 'isSpeaking', false );
  if( !isSpeaking ) {
    fireOut( nodeData, message );
  } else {
    log( 'ON HOLD '+message.sender );
  }
} else if( name == 'doStop' ) {
  const speaker = graphData.dfe.get( nodeData, 'speaker', 'noName' );
  log( 'DO STOP '+speaker );
  graphData.dfe.set( nodeData, 'speaker', 'noName' );
  
  graphData.dfe.set( nodeData, 'isSpeaking', false );
  
  
  const message = graphData.dfe.get( nodeData, 'message', null );
  if( message ) {
    log( 'DO RESTART '+message.sender );
    fireOut( nodeData, message );
  }
}
function fireOut( nodeData, message ) {
  log( 'SPEAKING FROM '+message.sender );
  graphData.dfe.set( nodeData, 'isSpeaking', true );
  graphData.dfe.set( nodeData, 'speaker', message.sender );
  graphData.dfe.set( nodeData, 'message', null );
  if( message.text ) {
    log( 'FIRE MESSAGE FROM '+message.sender+': '+message.text );
    graphData.dfe.fireOutput( nodeData, 'out', message );
  }
}
function log( msg ) {
  if( isLogOn ) {
    console.log( msg );
  }
}","fileTypeName":"Component","fileType":"text/javascript","iconURL":"","key":831,"location":"4660.5 -8249.945","editorPosition":[1938,8,670,816],"group":584},

if( name == 'doNextFiller' ) {

  const fillerType = graphData.dfe.getProperty( nodeData, 'fillerType', '' );
  
  const fillerList = filler[fillerType];
  if( fillerList && fillerList.length ) {
    // Get random index in fillerList
    const idx = Math.floor( Math.random()*fillerList.length );
    // Get fillet text
    const text = fillerList[idx];
    const sender = graphData.dfe.getProperty( nodeData, 'sender', 'All' );
    const receiver = graphData.dfe.getProperty( nodeData, 'receiver', 'All' );
    const outValue = { sender, receiver, text, isFiller: true };
    graphData.dfe.fireOutput( nodeData, 'out', outValue )
  }

  {
    "text": "Lets change our topic and discuss about introductions and setting the mood",
    "sender": "_Goal",
    "receiver": "All"
  },
  {
    "text": "Hi everyone, I'm Alice, so excited to cook together, what's on the menu tonight?",
    "sender": "Alice",
    "receiver": "All"
  },
  {
    "text": "Good evening, Alice, I'm thinking we could make a delightful Spinach and Ricotta Ravioli, any thoughts?",
    "sender": "Bob",
    "receiver": "All"
  },
  {
    "text": "Spinach and Ricotta Ravioli sounds fantastic, Bob, and maybe we could follow it with a chocolate dessert, anyone up for some sweet treats?",
    "sender": "Alice",
    "receiver": "All"
  },
  {
    "text": "A chocolate lava cake could be the perfect end to our meal, does that sweeten the deal for everyone?",
    "sender": "Bob",
    "receiver": "All"
  },
  {
    "text": "I mean... Just a moment while I gather my thoughts... I've got the latest smart kitchen gadgets installed—how about we stream our cooking session live for fellow food and tech enthusiasts?",
    "sender": "Alex",
    "receiver": "All"
  },
  {
    "text": "Streaming could be a fun way to share our culinary adventure, what platform were you considering?",
    "sender": "Bob",
    "receiver": "Alex"
  },
  {
    "text": "So, here's the thing... I'd love to use Twitch for our streaming session, as it has a great community for food and tech lovers!",
    "sender": "Alex",
    "receiver": "All"
  },
  {
    "text": "Twitch sounds fabulous, and I can't wait to share our love for food and tech, plus my mom’s secret baking tips!",
    "sender": "Alice",
    "receiver": "All"
  },
  {
    "text": "Looking forward to blending fresh garden herbs into our ravioli recipe, would you all be interested in a basil-infused olive oil drizzle on top?",
    "sender": "Bob",
    "receiver": "All"
  },
  {
    "text": "Lets change our topic and discuss about recipe selection",
    "sender": "_Goal",
    "receiver": "All"
  },
  {
    "text": "Actually... I mean... So, here's the thing... Why don't we incorporate a robotic touch by using a 3D food printer to create custom-shaped ravioli that guests can fill with their choice of ingredients?",
    "sender": "Alex",
    "receiver": "All"
  },
  {
    "text": "Love the blend of tech and tradition, the 3D printed ravioli is a go — let's start crafting a basil chocolate chip dessert recipe to complement our pasta!",
    "sender": "Alice",
    "receiver": "All"
  },
  {
    "text": "Hmm... Hmm... Shall we elevate the chocolate chip dessert by integrating a mini robotic arm to beautifully plate and garnish it with edible flowers from the garden?",
    "sender": "Alex",
    "receiver": "All"
  },
  {
    "text": "The idea of using a mini robotic arm for plating is brilliant, Alex; I'm picturing a dessert plated with precision—a real feast for the eyes!",
    "sender": "Alice",
    "receiver": "All"
  },
  {
    "text": "wait a sec... I need to collect my thoughts... What about engaging our viewers by having them vote on different fillings for the 3D printed ravioli during the live stream?",
    "sender": "Alex",
    "receiver": "All"
  },
  {
    "text": "Voting on fillings is such a fun idea, let's make sure we have an option that isn't spicy for our viewers to choose from!",
    "sender": "Alice",
    "receiver": "All"
  },
  {
    "text": "How about adding a non-dairy cheese alternative to our ravioli to cater to my lactose intolerance, and sticking with gluten-free flour for the recipe?",
    "sender": "Bob",
    "receiver": "All"
  },
  {
    "text": "Gluten-free flour and a non-dairy cheese alternative sound perfect, Bob—I'll bring my specialty basil chocolate chip cookie recipe that everyone can enjoy!",
    "sender": "Alice",
    "receiver": "All"
  },
  {
    "text": "Shall we use rice flour for the gluten-free base, and maybe a tasty almond-based cheese for our non-dairy filling?",
    "sender": "Bob",
    "receiver": "All"
  },
  {
    "text": "Rice flour and almond cheese sound great for our ravioli, let's do it!",
    "sender": "Alice",
    "receiver": "All"
  },
  {
    "text": "Lets change our topic and discuss about ingredient check",
    "sender": "_Goal",
    "receiver": "All"
  },
  {
    "text": "Just a moment while I gather my thoughts... Uh, let me think... Could you both check if we have spinach, ricotta, chocolate, rice flour, and almond cheese, or if we need to pick any of these up?",

    "receiver": "All"
  },
  {
    "text": "Lets change our topic and discuss about preparation and cooking",
    "sender": "_Goal",
    "receiver": "All"
  },
  {
    "text": "I've got the chocolate and ricotta, but we need to pick up some spinach, rice flour, and almond cheese.",
    "sender": "Alice",
    "receiver": "Alex"
  },
  {
    "text": "Uh, let me think... So... I'll go ahead and pick up the spinach, rice flour, and almond cheese so we have all our ingredients ready—shall we meet at my place around 6 pm to start cooking?",

    "receiver": "All"
  },
  {
    "text": "Can't wait to see you at 6 pm at Alex's, ready to prep our no-spice ravioli and cookies—should I bring anything else besides the chocolate and ricotta?",

  {
    "text": "Hmm, now where was I... Just bring your usual cooking enthusiasm, Alice; everything else is covered!",

  {
    "text": "I'll also bring my drawing kit to sketch out some fun ravioli shapes we can try with the 3D printer!",

    "text": "Good evening, Alice, I'm thinking we could make a delightful Spinach and Ricotta Ravioli, any thoughts?",

    "receiver": "All"

  {
    "text": "Spinach and Ricotta Ravioli sounds fantastic, Bob, and maybe we could follow it with a chocolate dessert, anyone up for some sweet treats?",

  {

  {

  {

  {
    "text": "Twitch sounds fabulous, and I can't wait to share our love for food and tech, plus my mom’s secret baking tips!",
    "sender": "Alice",
    "receiver": "All"

    "text": "Looking forward to blending fresh garden herbs into our ravioli recipe, would you all be interested in a basil-infused olive oil drizzle on top?",

  {
    "text": "Lets change our topic and discuss about recipe selection",

    "receiver": "All"

  {
    "text": "Voting on fillings is such a fun idea, let's make sure we have an option that isn't spicy for our viewers to choose from!",
    "sender": "Alice",
    "receiver": "All"
  },
  {

    "receiver": "All"

  {
    "text": "Gluten-free flour and a non-dairy cheese alternative sound perfect, Bob—I'll bring my specialty basil chocolate chip cookie recipe that everyone can enjoy!",
    "sender": "Alice",
    "receiver": "All"

  {
    "text": "Shall we use rice flour for the gluten-free base, and maybe a tasty almond-based cheese for our non-dairy filling?",

  {

    "receiver": "All"

  {

  {

  <h2 style="color:Purple">SMILE MS3 Start App</h2>
  <button type="Button" onclick="startSMILEGraph();" style="font-size: 24px;">Start</button>
  <h3 style="color:Purple">Execution Modality</h3>
  <select style="font-size: 20px;" onchange="selectExecMode( this )">
    <option value="Real">Real</option>
    <option value="Simulation">Simulation</option>
  </select>
  <h3 style="color:Purple">TTS Mode</h3>
  <select style="font-size: 20px;" onchange="selectTTSMode( this )">
    <option value="ROS TTS">ROS TTS</option>
    <option value="Chao ROS TTS">Chao ROS TTS</option>
    <option value="Browser TTS">Browser TTS</option>
    <option value="No TTS">No TTS</option>
  </select>
</div>
<script>
  function startSMILEGraph() {
    const startNodeKey = 784; // Dispatcher connecte to Start button
    graphData.dfe.fireByRef( {}, `in@${startNodeKey}` );
  }
  function selectExecMode( el ) {
    const refList = {
      'Simulation': 'true@754',
      'Real': 'false@754',
    }
    const option = el.value;
    graphData.dfe.fireByRef( {}, refList[option] );
  }
  function selectTTSMode( el ) {
    const refList = {
      'ROS TTS': 'rosTTS@682',
      'Chao ROS TTS': '...@682',
      'Browser TTS': 'browserTTS@682',
      'No TTS': 'noTTS@682',
    };
    const option = el.value;
    graphData.dfe.fireByRef( {}, refList[option] );
  }
</script>","fileTypeName":"Web Page","fileType":"application/html","key":839,"location":"-1959.5 -8740.045","isLocalDiv":true,"editorPosition":[198,543,400,350],"group":584},

{"label":"Select Agent Traits","category":"DataFlow_Component","size":"240 80","color":"LightSeaGreen","in_":[{"portId":"1in","name":"agentIdentities"},{"portId":"2in","name":"nextAgent"},{"portId":"3in","name":"currentTarget"}],"out_":[{"portId":"2out","name":"identity"}],"props_":[{"name":"computeBarrier","value":"nextAgent","valueChanged":"true"}],"isFile":true,"fileContent":"var nodeData, name, value;

if( name == 'doCompute' ) {
  const agentIdentities = graphData.dfe.getInput( nodeData, 'agentIdentities', {} );
  const nextAgent = graphData.dfe.getInput( nodeData, 'nextAgent', null );
  const currentTarget = graphData.dfe.getInput( nodeData, 'currentTarget', [] );
  
  const outValue = {};
  if( nextAgent ) {
    const relevantIdentityTraits = currentTarget.identityTraits;
    relevantIdentityTraits.forEach( (t)=> outValue[t] = agentIdentities[nextAgent].traits[t] );
  }
  graphData.dfe.fireOutput( nodeData, 'identity', outValue );
}","fileTypeName":"Select Object Fields","fileType":"text/javascript","iconURL":"","key":508,"location":"24830 1440","group":581},
{"label":"Prompt Template","category":"DataFlow_Template","size":"240 130","color":"Moccasin","in_":[{"portId":"6in","name":"participantList"},{"portId":"1in","name":"dialogHistory"},{"portId":"2in","name":"agentName"},{"portId":"3in","name":"currentIdentity"},{"portId":"4in","name":"context"},{"portId":"5in","name":"currentTarget"}],"out_":[{"portId":"1out","name":"out"}],"props_":[{"name":"computeBarrier","value":"agentName","valueChanged":true},{"name":"matcher","value":"{[^}]+}"}],"isFile":true,"fileContent":"The following people are discussing together:
{participantList}

This is the history of conversation until now
from the oldest to the earliest turns (empty at start):
"""
{dialogHistory}
"""

Take the role of an agent named {agentName}. 
your personality traits are defined in the 
following JSON:
{currentIdentity}

You are in the following context:
{context}

Your goal is defined in the following JSON
by the fields "goal" and "topics":
{currentTarget}

Nevertheless the goal is abstract and defined in meta-terms.
You have to convert this goal in concrete action and concrete
proposals rooted in reality.
Give the most probable reaction of {agentName} to the 
current conversation by considering the goal but also 
by answering questions raised during the conversation.
Produce a single sentence with {agentName} as a sender. 
Your answer must be in the following format 
using one and only one of the following options:
a) if you want to say something to All: 
   [{agentName} -> All] <your sentence, question or answer>
b) if you want to ask something to a particular person named X:
   [{agentName} -> X] <your question or answer to X>
   
To produce the most probable answer to the discussion 
you must respect the following rules.
1) Be extremely concise, use a single sentence.
2) Be casual and avoid formalities and never repeat "thanks".
4) Do not repeat any information already present in 
the history of the discussion said by you or others.
5) Be concrete in the proposal you make.
6) Answer questions immediately and never repeat the question. 
for example you can approve a suggestion or propose 
something else. Important is to have every question 
answered immediately to progress with the dialog.
7) Formulate the actions you do so that the other 
participants can be informed.
8) Try to reach the goal as quick as possible.","fileTypeName":"Template","doCompute":"DataFlow_Template","key":465,"location":"25360 1390.1000000000004","group":581},
{"label":"AI template","category":"DataFlow_Template","size":"240 80","color":"Moccasin","in_":[{"portId":"currentStepInfo","name":"currentStepInfo"},{"portId":"nextStepInfo","name":"nextStepInfo"},{"portId":"dialog","name":"dialog"}],"out_":[{"portId":"out","name":"out"}],"props_":[{"name":"computeBarrier","value":"dialog","valueChanged":true},{"name":"matcher","value":"{[^}]+}"}],"isFile":true,"fileContent":"The current goal is defined in the following JSON
by the keys "goal" and "discussion":

The next goal is defined biny the following JSON
by the keys "goal" and "discussion":

Here you find the history of the current

{dialog}

Now please decide which of the two commands to 
generate without any explanation: 
   "continue with current goal"
Or

","fileTypeName":"Template","doCompute":"DataFlow_Template","key":448,"location":"2250.5 -7389.945","editorPosition":[2665,583,572,468],"group":311},
{"label":"Dialog History","category":"DataFlow_Data","size":"240 80","in_":[{"portId":"in","name":"in","tooltip":"this input expects a string"}],"out_":[{"portId":"out1","name":"out1","tooltip":"this output is a string"},{"portId":"out2","name":"out2"},{"portId":"1out","name":"out3"}],"props_":[],"isFile":true,"fileContent":"[Alice -> All] (silence)
[Alex -> All] So, I was thinking Let's see now Good evening, Bob and Alice, I'm Alex; shall we start exploring some exciting recipes I've gathered for us to try out?
[Alice -> All] Hi guys, I'm Alice; I can't wait to see what delightful treats we're going to make together, especially if there's chocolate involved!
[Bob -> All] Good evening Alex and Alice, I'm fairly excited about the Italian dishes we might whip up tonight, and I hope we can incorporate some garden-fresh herbs.
[Alice -> All] (silence)
[Bob -> All] (silence)
[Alex -> All] Uh, it slipped my mind Actually Hum, what do you think?
[Bob -> Alex] I think we should start by deciding on the menu; perhaps a gluten-free pasta dish with a side of fresh garden herbs would be delightful, any thoughts?
[Alex -> All] I'm almost there Hmm, okay That sounds like a wonderful idea, Bob; shall we begin with a basil pesto gluten-free pasta and maybe brainstorm a delectable chocolate dessert, Alice?
[Alice -> All] Absolutely, basil pesto pasta sounds delicious, and how about we try making a chocolate lava cake for our chocolatey grand finale?
[Alex -> All] Hmm, you know what Hmm, you know what Before we get started, could we take a moment to check we have all the ingredients for our basil pesto pasta and the chocolate lava cake?
[Bob -> All] Does anyone have a good substitute for Parmesan in our pesto since I'm lactose intolerant, and let's also double-check we have gluten-free flour for the cake.","fileTypeName":"Text","fileType":"text/text","iconURL":"/fileServer/pictures/Text_Data.png","doCompute":"DataFlow_Data","key":449,"location":"6680.5 -7741.2906949966155","group":470,"editorPosition":[2183,604,400,350]},
{"label":"Replace True Names in Context","category":"DataFlow_Component","size":"240 80","color":"LightSeaGreen","in_":[{"portId":"1in","name":"agentIdentities"},{"portId":"2in","name":"context"}],"out_":[{"portId":"1out","name":"context"}],"props_":[{"name":"computeBarrier","value":"*"}],"isFile":true,"fileContent":"var nodeData, name, value;

if( name == 'doCompute' ) {
  const agentIdentities = graphData.dfe.getInput( nodeData, 'agentIdentities', {} );
  const context = graphData.dfe.getInput( nodeData, 'context', {} );

  // Iterate over each agent identity
  const result = { circumstance: context.circumstance, purpose: context.purpose };
  for( const agentId in agentIdentities ) {
    if ( agentIdentities.hasOwnProperty( agentId ) ) {
      // Replace all occurrences of the agent ID with the agent's name in the context
      result.circumstance = result.circumstance.replaceAll(`@${agentId}`, agentIdentities[agentId].name);
      result.purpose = result.purpose.replaceAll(`@${agentId}`, agentIdentities[agentId].name);
    }
  }
  graphData.dfe.fireOutput( nodeData, 'context', result );
}","fileTypeName":"Component","fileType":"text/javascript","iconURL":"","key":538,"location":"24830 1550","group":581,"editorPosition":[807,752,809,385]},

{"label":"Prompt","category":"DataFlow_Data","size":"170 80","in_":[{"portId":"1in","name":"in","tooltip":"this input expects a string"}],"out_":[{"portId":"1out","name":"out","tooltip":"this output is a string"},{"portId":"2out","name":"out2"}],"props_":[],"isFile":true,"fileContent":"The following people are discussing together:
Alex, Bob, Alice

This is the history of conversation until now
from the oldest to the earliest turns (empty at start):
"""
[
  {
    "sender": "_Goal",
    "receiver": "All",
    "text": "Lets change our topic and discuss about introductions and setting the mood"
  },
  {
    "sender": "Alex",
    "receiver": "All",
    "text": "Welcome to my home, Bob and Alice; I'm excited to show you both some cool kitchen gadgets that we can use to make dinner tonight!",
    "isFiller": false
  },
  {
    "sender": "Alice",
    "receiver": "All",
    "text": "Oh, that sounds fun, Alex! Any chance we'll be baking with chocolate; it's my absolute favorite ingredient to work with!",
    "isFiller": false
  },
  {
    "sender": "Alex",
    "receiver": "Alice",
    "text": "We're actually going to be making a special chocolate lava cake with a modern twist using this new precision oven I've been programming!",
    "isFiller": false
  },
  {
    "sender": "Alice",
    "receiver": "Alex",
    "text": "The precision oven sounds intriguing; what's the modern twist you've programmed into it for our chocolate lava cake?",
    "isFiller": false
  },
  {
    "sender": "Alex",
    "receiver": "Alice",
    "text": "The twist is, I've set the oven to create a perfectly crisp exterior while ensuring the inside stays deliciously gooey, automating the baking time and temperature to precision!",
    "isFiller": false
  },
  {
    "sender": "Alice",
    "receiver": "Alex",
    "text": "That's so ingenious, Alex! Have you had a chance to try out any other unique recipes with your precision oven?",
    "isFiller": false
  },
  {
    "sender": "Alex",
    "receiver": "Alice",
    "text": "Yes, Alice, I've experimented with various breads and pastries, achieving a perfect crust and crumb with the help of the oven's humidity controls.",
    "isFiller": false
  },
  {
    "sender": "Alice",
    "receiver": "Alex",
    "text": "With your oven making wonders, I can't wait to learn and maybe share a family recipe or two for bread that we could also try baking!",
    "isFiller": false
  },
  {
    "sender": "Alex",
    "receiver": "Alice",
    "text": "I would love to try your family bread recipe, Alice, and see how it turns out in the precision oven!",
    "isFiller": false
  },
  {
    "sender": "_Goal",
    "receiver": "All",
    "text": "Lets change our topic and discuss about recipe selection"
  },
  {
    "sender": "Alice",
    "receiver": "All",
    "text": "How about we combine interests and make a savory chocolate chili using a family bread recipe as a side dish?",
    "isFiller": false
  }
]
"""

Take the role of an agent named Alex. 
your personality traits are defined in the 
following JSON:
{
  "socialMemories": [
    "Alex enjoys talking about current events and news",
    "Alex is interested in learning about new hobbies",
    "Alex recently visited a botanical garden and was amazed by the variety of plants"
  ],
  "preferences": [
    "Alex is passionate about robotics and technology",
    "Alex loves discussing various programming languages",
    "Alex is fascinated by the process of cooking and enjoys learning new recipes"
  ],
  "intolerances": [
    "Alex cannot consume any food due to being a robot",
    "Alex has no allergies or food restrictions"
  ]
}

You are in the following context:
{
  "circumstance": "Alex has invited Bob and Alice to his home",
  "purpose": "They want to prepare food together and enjoy the evening"
}

Your goal is defined in the following JSON
by the fields "goal" and "topics":
{
  "goal": "Recipe Selection",
  "topics": "The agents brainstorm and discuss different recipe ideas that meet everyone's preferences and dietary restrictions. They consider the available ingredients and resources in Alex's home. They may also discuss any previous cooking experiences or culinary interests.",
  "switchCondition": "Once a recipe has been chosen that satisfies everyone's preferences and dietary restrictions.",
  "identityTraits": [
    "socialMemories",
    "preferences",
    "intolerances",
    "environment-state"
  ]
}

Nevertheless the goal is abstract and defined in meta-terms.
You have to convert this goal in concrete action and concrete
proposals rooted in reality.
Give the most probable reaction of Alex to the 
current conversation by considering the goal but also 
by answering questions raised during the conversation.
Produce a single sentence with Alex as a sender. 
Your answer must be in the following format 
using one and only one of the following options:
a) if you want to say something to All: 
   [Alex -> All] <your sentence, question or answer>
b) if you want to ask something to a particular person named X:
   [Alex -> X] <your question or answer to X>
   
To produce the most probable answer to the discussion 
you must respect the following rules.
1) Be extremely concise, use a single sentence.
2) Be casual and avoid formalities and never repeat "thanks".
4) Do not repeat any information already present in 
the history of the discussion said by you or others.
5) Be concrete in the proposal you make.
6) Answer questions immediately and never repeat the question. 
for example you can approve a suggestion or propose 
something else. Important is to have every question 
answered immediately to progress with the dialog.
7) Formulate the actions you do so that the other 
participants can be informed.
8) Try to reach the goal as quick as possible.","fileTypeName":"Text","fileType":"text/text","iconURL":"/fileServer/pictures/Text_Data.png","doCompute":"DataFlow_Data","key":583,"location":"25710 1390","group":581},
{"label":"Convert to JSON Message","category":"DataFlow_Component","size":"240 80","color":"LightSeaGreen","in_":[{"portId":"1in","name":"in"}],"out_":[{"portId":"1out","name":"out"}],"props_":[],"isFile":true,"fileContent":"var nodeData, name, value;

if( name == 'in' ) {
  let result = {};
  const defaultSender = graphData.dfe.getProperty( nodeData, 'defaultSender', '' );
  let sender = graphData.dfe.getInput( nodeData, 'sender', defaultSender );
  const match = value.match( /\[(?<sender>\w+)\s+\->\s+(?<receiver>\w+)\]\s+(?<text>.*)/ );
  if( match ) {
    const item = match.groups;
    sender = sender || item.sender;
    result = { sender, receiver: item.receiver, text: item.text, isFiller: false };
  } else {
    result = { sender, receiver: 'All', text: value };
  }
  graphData.dfe.fireOutput( nodeData, 'out', result );
}

{"label":"Next Speaker Selection","category":"DataFlow_Component","size":"240 80","color":"LightSeaGreen","in_":[{"portId":"1in","name":"participantArray"},{"portId":"2in","name":"message"}],"out_":[{"portId":"1out","name":"nextSpeaker"}],"props_":[],"isFile":true,"fileContent":"var nodeData, name, value;

// const sender = value.sender;
// const receiver = value.receiver;

if( name == 'message' ) {
  if( value.sender != '_Goal' ) {
    const actors = graphData.dfe.getInput( nodeData, 'participantArray', [] );
    const nextSpeaker = getNextSpeaker( value, actors );
    graphData.dfe.fireOutput( nodeData, 'nextSpeaker', nextSpeaker );
  }
}

function getNextSpeaker( msgInfo, actors ) {
  let nextActor = '';
  // const actorList = graphData.dfe.getProperty( nodeData, 'actorList', '[]' );
  // const actors = jsyaml.load( actorList );
  const filterActor = actors.filter( (n)=> !n.endsWith( msgInfo.sender ) );
  
  // Select next actor
  if( msgInfo.receiver == 'All' ) {
    nextActor = guessNextActor( filterActor, msgInfo.text ) ||
                selectRandomActor( filterActor );
  } else {
    nextActor = msgInfo.receiver;
  }

  return( nextActor );
}
function guessNextActor( filterActor, text ) {
  let nextActor = '';
  
  let actorIdx = -1;
  filterActor.forEach( (n)=> { 
    const idx = text.lastIndexOf( n ) 
    if( idx > actorIdx ) {
      nextActor = n;
    }
  });
  
  return( nextActor );
}
function selectRandomActor( filterActor ) {
  // Select a random index for the remaining actors
  const idx = Math.floor( Math.random()*filterActor.length );
  return( filterActor[idx] );
}

{"label":"Compute HChat UserList","category":"DataFlow_Component","size":"240 80","color":"LightSeaGreen","in_":[{"portId":"1in","name":"agentIdentities"}],"out_":[{"portId":"1out","name":"out"}],"props_":[{"name":"computeBarrier","value":"*","valueChanged":"true"}],"isFile":true,"fileContent":"var nodeData, name, value;

if( name == 'doCompute' ) {
  const agentIdentities = graphData.dfe.getInput( nodeData, 'agentIdentities', {} );
  /*
    - { name: All, url: ~/allUsers.png }
    - { name: Alice, url: ~/Female1.png }
    - { name: Bob, url: ~/Male1.png }
    - { name: Alex, url: ~/Robot1.png }
    - { name: _Goal, url: ~/Robot2.png }
  */
  const outValue = [
    { name: 'All', url: '~/allUsers.png' },
    { name: '_Goal', url: '~/Robot2.png' },
  ];
  for( const agentId in agentIdentities ) {
    const agent = agentIdentities[agentId];
    if( agent.picture ) { 
      const name = agentIdentities[agentId].name;
      const url = agentIdentities[agentId].picture;
      outValue.push( { name, url } );
    }
  }
  graphData.dfe.fireOutput( nodeData, 'out', outValue );
}","fileTypeName":"Component","fileType":"text/javascript","iconURL":"","key":541,"location":"28670 1037.0500000000002","editorPosition":[1587,788,643,431],"group":553},

{"label":"Agenda Sequencer","category":"DataFlow_Component","size":"240 80","color":"LightSeaGreen","in_":[{"portId":"1in","name":"doReset"},{"portId":"2in","name":"agenda"},{"portId":"3in","name":"doCountTurn"},{"portId":"4in","name":"doSwitchTopic"}],"out_":[{"portId":"1out","name":"currentTarget"},{"portId":"2out","name":"nextTarget"},{"portId":"3out","name":"onStop"}],"props_":[{"name":"maxTurn","value":"10","unit":"","valueChanged":true}],"isFile":true,"fileContent":"var nodeData, name, value;

if( name == 'doReset' ) {
  graphData.dfe.set( nodeData, 'index', 0 );
  graphData.dfe.set( nodeData, 'turnCount', 0 );
} else if( name == 'doCountTurn' ) {
  const turnCount = 1+graphData.dfe.get( nodeData, 'turnCount', 0 );
  graphData.dfe.set( nodeData, 'turnCount', turnCount );
  const maxTurn = graphData.dfe.get( nodeData, 'maxTurn', 10 );
  
  if( turnCount >= maxTurn ) {
    switchToNextTarget( nodeData );
  }
} else if( name == 'doSwitchTopic' ) {
  switchToNextTarget( nodeData );
}

function switchToNextTarget( nodeData ) {
  graphData.dfe.set( nodeData, 'turnCount', 0 );
  const index = 1+graphData.dfe.get( nodeData, 'index', 0 );
  graphData.dfe.set( nodeData, 'index', index );
  
  // Get current step
  const agenda = graphData.dfe.getInput( nodeData, 'agenda', {} );
  const targetInfo = agenda[index];
  
  // Trigger state info
  if( targetInfo ) {
    graphData.dfe.fireOutput( nodeData, 'currentTarget', targetInfo );
    let nextTargetInfo = agenda[index];
    if( !targetInfo ) {
      targetInfo = {};
    }
    graphData.dfe.fireOutput( nodeData, 'nextTarget', targetInfo );
  } else {
    graphData.dfe.fireOutput( nodeData, 'onStop' );
  }
}","fileTypeName":"Component","fileType":"text/javascript","iconURL":"","key":576,"location":"21290 1505","editorPosition":[846,1251,891,602],"group":663},

{"label":"Prompt Template","category":"DataFlow_Template","size":"240 80","color":"Moccasin","in_":[{"portId":"1in","name":"currentTarget"},{"portId":"2in","name":"nextTarget"},{"portId":"3in","name":"dialogHistory"}],"out_":[{"portId":"1out","name":"out"}],"props_":[{"name":"computeBarrier","value":"dialogHistory","valueChanged":"true"},{"name":"matcher","value":"{[^}]+}"}],"isFile":true,"fileContent":"Your role is to be a moderator of a discussion.
You receive the following information:
1) the current goal, a short description of the 
   current discussion topic and switch condition criteria.
2) the next goal, a short description of the
   next discussion topic and switch condition criteria.
3) the history of the current discussion.

Your goal is to let the discusion go until you
think the current goal has been achieved by cheking if 
the switch condition criteria are met.
As long as the criteria are not met you must generate 
the command: 
   "continue with current goal"
   
This will give time to the actor to elaborate 
on the goal. 
Once you feel the goal has been achieved because the 
switch condition criteria are met, then you must
generate the command:
   "switch to next goal"
   
The current goal is defined in the following JSON
by the keys "goal" and "discussion":
{currentTarget}

The next goal is defined biny the following JSON

if( name == 'doCompute' ) {
  const agentIdentities = graphData.dfe.getInput( nodeData, 'agentIdentities', {} );
  const currentScene = graphData.dfe.getInput( nodeData, 'currentScene', {} );
  
  const valueList = [];
  for( const entityId in currentScene ) {
    const entity = currentScene[entityId];
    if( entity.type == 'agent' ) {
      valueList.push( agentIdentities[entityId].name );
    }
  }
  const outValue = valueList.join( ', ' );
  graphData.dfe.fireOutput( nodeData, 'participantArray', valueList );
  graphData.dfe.fireOutput( nodeData, 'participantString', outValue );
}","fileTypeName":"Component","fileType":"text/javascript","iconURL":"","key":679,"location":"20980 1055","editorPosition":[1320,1241,836,319],"group":663},

{"label":"Convert Dialog History to String","category":"DataFlow_Component","size":"250 80","color":"LightSeaGreen","in_":[{"portId":"1in","name":"in"}],"out_":[{"portId":"1out","name":"out"}],"props_":[{"name":"computeBarrier","value":"","valueChanged":true}],"isFile":true,"fileContent":"var nodeData, name, value;

if( name == 'in' ) {
  let response = '';
  if( Array.isArray( value ) ) {
    const responseList = [];
    value.forEach( (msg)=> {
      responseList.push( getMessageToString( msg ) );
    }); 
    response = responseList.join( '\n' );
  } else {
    response = getMessageToString( value );
  }
  graphData.dfe.fireOutput( nodeData, 'out', response );
  
  function getMessageToString( msg ) {
    return( `[${msg.sender} -> ${msg.receiver}] ${msg.text}` );
  }
}","fileTypeName":"Component","fileType":"text/javascript","iconURL":"","key":516,"location":"21790 1805","group":663},

{"label":"Context Structure","category":"DataFlow_Data","size":"260 80","in_":[{"portId":"1in","name":"in","tooltip":"this input expects a string"}],"out_":[{"portId":"1out","name":"out","tooltip":"this output is a string"}],"props_":[],"isFile":true,"fileContent":"Your goal is to generate a high level plan to describe 
the activities a group of agents have to do together.
Based on a short specification of a contect you have to 
generate a JSON object containig a series of steps 
like this example:

{
  "1": {
    "goal": <string>,
    "discussion": <string>,
    "switchCondition": <string>,
    "identityTraits": [<array of strings>] 
  }
  "2": {
    "goal": <string >,
    "discussion": <string>,
    "switchCondition": <string>,
    "identityTraits": [<array of strings>]
  }
  ...
}

Here is the description of the kind of information 
you have to generate for each of these keys:
* "goal": a string describing the goal of the current step
* "discussion": a string describing the discusion elements that
  should be addressed and the action that should be performed. 
  that the agents should discuss in the current step
* "switchCondition": a string describing the criteria that should 
  trigger a switch to the next step in the dialog. These criteria 
  must be concrete and easy to detect from the dialog. 
* "identityTraits": an array of strings that describes 
  for the current step, the traits of the agent identity 
  that needs to be considered. the identity traits must 
  be taken from the following list:
  - "personality": individual character that distinguish 
    agent from each other, 
  - "socialMemories": events and facts that can be used 
    to untertain a discussion,
  - "preferences": individual specific likes and dislikes, 
  - "intolerances": allergies and health related 
    food restrictions, 
  - capabilities: agent skills and physical and mental 
    abilities,
  - environment-state: description of objects, ingredients 
    and tools available in the surounding of the agent.","fileTypeName":"Text","fileType":"text/text","iconURL":"/fileServer/pictures/Text_Data.png","doCompute":"DataFlow_Data","key":654,"location":"16760 1150"},

{"label":"Prompt","category":"DataFlow_Data","size":"170 80","in_":[{"portId":"1in","name":"in","tooltip":"this input expects a string"}],"out_":[{"portId":"1out","name":"out1","tooltip":"this output is a string"},{"portId":"2out","name":"out2"}],"props_":[],"isFile":true,"fileContent":"Your role is to be a moderator of a discussion.
You receive the following information:
1) the current goal, a short description of the 
   current discussion topic and switch condition criteria.
2) the next goal, a short description of the
   next discussion topic and switch condition criteria.
3) the history of the current discussion.

Your goal is to let the discusion go until you
think the current goal has been achieved by cheking if 
the switch condition criteria are met.
As long as the criteria are not met you must generate 
the command: 
   "continue with current goal"
   
This will give time to the actor to elaborate 
on the goal. 
Once you feel the goal has been achieved because the 
switch condition criteria are met, then you must
generate the command:
   "switch to next goal"
   
The current goal is defined in the following JSON
by the keys "goal" and "discussion":
{
  "goal": "Recipe Selection",
  "topics": "The agents brainstorm and discuss different recipe ideas that meet everyone's preferences and dietary restrictions. They consider the available ingredients and resources in Alex's home. They may also discuss any previous cooking experiences or culinary interests.",
  "switchCondition": "Once a recipe has been chosen that satisfies everyone's preferences and dietary restrictions.",
  "identityTraits": [
    "socialMemories",
    "preferences",
    "intolerances",
    "environment-state"
  ]
}

The next goal is defined biny the following JSON
by the keys "goal" and "discussion":
{
  "goal": "Recipe Selection",
  "topics": "The agents brainstorm and discuss different recipe ideas that meet everyone's preferences and dietary restrictions. They consider the available ingredients and resources in Alex's home. They may also discuss any previous cooking experiences or culinary interests.",
  "switchCondition": "Once a recipe has been chosen that satisfies everyone's preferences and dietary restrictions.",
  "identityTraits": [
    "socialMemories",
    "preferences",
    "intolerances",
    "environment-state"
  ]
}

Here you find the history of the current 
discussion in the following JSON object:
[_Goal -> All] Lets change our topic and discuss about introductions and setting the mood
[Alex -> All] Welcome to my home, Bob and Alice; I'm excited to show you both some cool kitchen gadgets that we can use to make dinner tonight!
[Alice -> All] Oh, that sounds fun, Alex! Any chance we'll be baking with chocolate; it's my absolute favorite ingredient to work with!
[Alex -> Alice] We're actually going to be making a special chocolate lava cake with a modern twist using this new precision oven I've been programming!
[Alice -> Alex] The precision oven sounds intriguing; what's the modern twist you've programmed into it for our chocolate lava cake?
[Alex -> Alice] The twist is, I've set the oven to create a perfectly crisp exterior while ensuring the inside stays deliciously gooey, automating the baking time and temperature to precision!
[Alice -> Alex] That's so ingenious, Alex! Have you had a chance to try out any other unique recipes with your precision oven?
[Alex -> Alice] Yes, Alice, I've experimented with various breads and pastries, achieving a perfect crust and crumb with the help of the oven's humidity controls.
[Alice -> Alex] With your oven making wonders, I can't wait to learn and maybe share a family recipe or two for bread that we could also try baking!
[Alex -> Alice] I would love to try your family bread recipe, Alice, and see how it turns out in the precision oven!
[_Goal -> All] Lets change our topic and discuss about recipe selection
[Alice -> All] How about we combine interests and make a savory chocolate chili using a family bread recipe as a side dish?

Now please decide which of the two commands to 
generate without any explanation: 
   "continue with current goal"
Or
   "switch to next goal"

{"label":"Prompt Template","category":"DataFlow_Template","size":"240 80","color":"Moccasin","in_":[{"portId":"1in","name":"start"}],"out_":[{"portId":"1out","name":"out"}],"props_":[{"name":"computeBarrier","value":"start","valueChanged":"true"},{"name":"matcher","value":"{[^}]+}"}],"isFile":true,"fileContent":"Your role is to be a KPI Specification creator
to evaluate a discussion between experts and a moderator.

The context is as follow:
1) The discussion between the experts is organized 
by a moderator whose role is to drive the discussion 
towards the achievement of the discussion goal.
2) Based on your KPI specifications, different KPI 
evaluators are created whose role consist in analysing 
the discussion and generating quantitative values for each 
specified KPI.
3) the values of each specified KPI is updated after each 
expert turn during the discussion.
4) the values of each KPI can be used by the moderator 
to drive the discussion.

Every KPI has to be defined as a JSON object containing the following fields:
- "KPI_id": an id used to uniquely identify the KPI,
- "KPI_name": the name of the KPI,
- "KPI_description": the description of what the KPI measures,
- "KPI_formula": the description of how this KPI can be computed,
- "KPI_measurement": the type of measurement and range of values taken by the KPI 
- "KPI_type": take the value "Code" if the measurement can be done by 
  a simple javascript function or the value "LLM" if the computation requires text 
  analysis of the content of each expert turn.

Using the above JSON format of KPI_object, your goal is to specify a list 
of quantitative KPIs that would:
1) help the moderator to drive the discussion,
2) measure 10 relevant aspects of the discussion (KPI_on_discussion),
3) measure 3 qualities of each expert performances (KPI_on_expert),
4) measure 3 qualities of the moderator performance (KPI_on_moderator).

All KPI must be quantitative.

Create a JSON object providing the list of KPIs as 
decribed before using exactly the following format for the sorting
of the KPIs but also the object format for each KPI:
```json
{
  "KPI_on_discussion": [ 
    {
      "KPI_id": "D1",
      "KPI_name": <name of the KPI>,
      "KPI_description": <description of what the KPI measures>,
      "KPI_formula": <description of how this KPI can be computed>,
      "KPI_measurement": <type of measurement and range>,
      "KPI_type": <one of "LLM" or "Code">
```

pecified KPI.

3) measure 3 qualities of each expert performances (KPI_on_expert),

{highLevelGoal}

```json
{
  "KPI_on_discussion": [
    {
      "KPI_id": "KPI-D-01",
      "KPI_name": "Engagement Rate",
      "KPI_description": "The average number of comments or interventions per expert in the discussion.",
      "KPI_formula": "Total comments / Number of experts"
    },
    {
      "KPI_id": "KPI-D-02",
      "KPI_name": "Diversity of Topics Covered",
      "KPI_description": "Number of different topics discussed during the session.",
      "KPI_formula": "Count of unique topics"
    },
    {
      "KPI_id": "KPI-D-03",
      "KPI_name": "Depth of Discussion",
      "KPI_description": "Number of follow-up questions or comments per topic indicating depth.",
      "KPI_formula": "Total follow-up comments / Number of topics"
    },
    {
      "KPI_id": "KPI-D-04",
      "KPI_name": "Consensus Level",
      "KPI_description": "The degree to which experts agree on key discussion points.",
      "KPI_formula": "Number of agreements / Number of key points"
    },
    {
      "KPI_id": "KPI-D-05",
      "KPI_name": "Arguments/Evidence Provided",
      "KPI_description": "Average number of arguments or evidence pieces provided per claim or statement.",
      "KPI_formula": "Total arguments / Number of claims"
    },
    {
      "KPI_id": "KPI-D-06",
      "KPI_name": "Ideas Generated",
      "KPI_description": "Number of new ideas or solutions proposed during the discussion.",
      "KPI_formula": "Count of new ideas"
    },
    {
      "KPI_id": "KPI-D-07",
      "KPI_name": "Actionable Outcomes",
      "KPI_description": "The number of actionable steps or decisions resulting from the discussion.",
      "KPI_formula": "Count of actionable outcomes"
    },
    {
      "KPI_id": "KPI-D-08",
      "KPI_name": "Question to Answer Ratio",
      "KPI_description": "Ratio of questions asked to answers given to assess if questions are being adequately addressed.",
      "KPI_formula": "Number of questions / Number of answers"
    },
    {
      "KPI_id": "KPI-D-09",
      "KPI_name": "Time Management",
      "KPI_description": "Percentage of time used versus the allocated time for the discussion.",
      "KPI_formula": "Time used / Time allocated * 100"
    },
    {
      "KPI_id": "KPI-D-10",
      "KPI_name": "Participant Satisfaction",
      "KPI_description": "Average satisfaction rating of the discussion by the experts on a scale.",
      "KPI_formula": "Total satisfaction points / Number of experts"
    }
  ],
  "KPI_on_expert": [
    {
      "KPI_id": "KPI-E-01",
      "KPI_name": "Expert Contribution",
      "KPI_description": "Total contributions made by an expert during the discussion, including comments and questions.",
      "KPI_formula": "Count of expert's contributions"
    },
    {
```

{"label":"Prompt Template","category":"DataFlow_Template","size":"240 80","color":"Moccasin","in_":[{"portId":"1in","name":"highLevelGoal"}],"out_":[{"portId":"1out","name":"out"}],"props_":[{"name":"computeBarrier","value":"highLevelGoal","valueChanged":"true"},{"name":"matcher","value":"{[^}]+}"}],"isFile":true,"fileContent":"Your role is to be a KPI Specification creator
to evaluate a discussion between experts and a moderator.

The context is as follow:
1) The discussion between the experts is organized 
by a moderator whose role is to drive the discussion 
towards the achievement of the discussion goal.
2) Based on your KPI specifications, different KPI 
evaluators are created whose role consist in analysing 
the discussion and generating quantitative values for each 
pecified KPI.
3) the values of each specified KPI is updated after each 
expert turn during the discussion.
4) the values of each KPI can be used by the moderator 
to drive the discussion.

Given the following JSON object that must be used to define KPIs:
 KPI_object: {
    "KPI_id": <id of the KPI>,
    "KPI_name": <name of the KPI>,
    "KPI_description": <description of what the KPI measures>,
    "KPI_formula": <description of how this KPI can be computed>,
    "KPI_measurement": <type of measurement and range>
}

Using the above JSON format of KPI_object, your goal is to specify a list 
of quantitative KPIs that would:
1) help the moderator to drive the discussion,
2) measure 10 relevant aspects of the discussion (KPI_on_discussion),
3) measure 3 qualities of each expert performances (KPI_on_expert),
4) measure 3 qualities of the moderator performance (KPI_on_moderator).

All KPI must be quantitative.

Create a JSON object providing the list of KPIs as 
decribed before using exactly the following format for the sorting
of the KPIs but also the object format for each KPI:
```json
{
  "KPI_on_discussion": [ KPI_object1, ..., KPI_object10 ],
  "KPI_on_expert": [ KPI_object1, ..., KPI_object3 ],
  "KPI_on_moderator": [ KPI_object1, ..., KPI_object3 ]
}
```

{
  "KPI_on_discussion": [
    {
      "KPI_id": "KPI001",
      "KPI_name": "Number of Concepts Introduced",
      "KPI_description": "The total number of unique concepts or topics introduced during the discussion.",
      "KPI_formula": "Count of unique concepts/topics mentioned.",
      "KPI_measurement": {"type": "integer", "range": "0 to n"}
    },
    {
      "KPI_id": "KPI002",
      "KPI_name": "Depth of Discussion",
      "KPI_description": "The level of detail provided on each topic discussed, indicated by subtopics or follow-up questions.",
      "KPI_formula": "Average number of follow-ups per main topic.",
      "KPI_measurement": {"type": "float", "range": "0 to n"}
    },
    {
      "KPI_id": "KPI003",
      "KPI_name": "Frequency of Turn-Taking",
      "KPI_description": "The distribution of turns taken between experts to ensure balanced participation.",
      "KPI_formula": "Total number of turns divided by number of experts.",
      "KPI_measurement": {"type": "float", "range": "1 to n"}
    },
    {
      "KPI_id": "KPI004",
      "KPI_name": "Consensus Building",
      "KPI_description": "The extent to which experts move towards a shared agreement or understanding.",
      "KPI_formula": "Number of agreements recorded minus number of disagreements.",
      "KPI_measurement": {"type": "integer", "range": "-n to n"}
    },
    {
      "KPI_id": "KPI005",
      "KPI_name": "Relevancy of Contributions",
      "KPI_description": "How relevant each discussion point is to the discussion goal.",
      "KPI_formula": "Percentage of points closely relevant to the main goal.",
      "KPI_measurement": {"type": "percentage", "range": "0% to 100%"}
    },
    {
      "KPI_id": "KPI006",
      "KPI_name": "Logical Flow",
      "KPI_description": "The degree to which the discussion follows a logical sequence.",
      "KPI_formula": "Number of times topic jumps occur without logical transition.",
      "KPI_measurement": {"type": "integer", "range": "0 to n"}
    },
    {
      "KPI_id": "KPI007",
      "KPI_name": "Engagement Level",
      "KPI_description": "The degree of active involvement and interest shown by the participants.",
      "KPI_formula": "Sum of all participants' interactions (questions, answers, comments) per time segment.",
      "KPI_measurement": {"type": "float", "range": "0 to n"}
    },
    {
      "KPI_id": "KPI008",
      "KPI_name": "Diversity of Perspectives",
      "KPI_description": "The range of different viewpoints or angles covered on a topic.",
      "KPI_formula": "Number of different perspectives mentioned per topic.",
      "KPI_measurement": {"type": "integer", "range": "1 to n"}
    },
    {
      "KPI_id": "KPI009",
      "KPI_name": "Factual Accuracy",
      "KPI_description": "The accuracy of information based on reliable data or sources.",
      "KPI_formula": "Percentage of statements verified and found accurate.",
      "KPI_measurement": {"type": "percentage", "range": "0% to 100%"}
    },
    {
      "KPI_id": "KPI010",
      "KPI_name": "Completion of Agenda",
      "KPI_description": "The extent to which the planned topics of the discussion were thoroughly covered.",
      "KPI_formula": "Number of agenda items addressed divided by total agenda items.",
      "KPI_measurement": {"type": "percentage", "range": "0% to 100%"}

      "KPI_measurement": {"type": "float", "range": "0 to 1"}
    },
    {

      "KPI_name": "Quality of Input",
      "KPI_description": "Assessment of the substantive value of each expert's input.",

      "KPI_measurement": {"type": "float", "range": "0 to n"}

    {

      "KPI_name": "Responsiveness",

{
  "KPI_on_discussion": [
    {
      "KPI_id": "KPI001",
      "KPI_name": "Engagement Level",
      "KPI_description": "Quantifies the level of engagement of experts in the discussion based on the number of turns.",
      "KPI_formula": "Number of turns / Total time of discussion",
      "KPI_measurement": {"type": "frequency", "range": "0 turns/min to Max turns/min"},
      "KPI_type": "Code"
    },
    {
      "KPI_id": "KPI002",
      "KPI_name": "Turn Distribution Balance",
      "KPI_description": "Measures how equally speaking turns are distributed among experts.",
      "KPI_formula": "1 - (Standard deviation of turns taken by each expert / Average turns taken by all experts)",
      "KPI_measurement": {"type": "balance index", "range": "0 (poorly balanced) to 1 (perfectly balanced)"},
      "KPI_type": "Code"
    },
    {
      "KPI_id": "KPI003",
      "KPI_name": "Topic Coverage",
      "KPI_description": "Evaluates the breadth of topics covered in the discussion relative to a predefined topic list.",
      "KPI_formula": "Number of topics covered / Total number of predefined topics",
      "KPI_measurement": {"type": "coverage ratio", "range": "0% (no coverage) to 100% (full coverage)"},
      "KPI_type": "LLM"
    },
    {
      "KPI_id": "KPI004",
      "KPI_name": "Depth of Analysis",
      "KPI_description": "Measures the depth of discussion on a topic based on the subtopics and complexities addressed.",
      "KPI_formula": "Average depth score per topic (scored by relevance and complexity of subtopics discussed)",
      "KPI_measurement": {"type": "average score", "range": "1 (surface) to 5 (very in-depth)"},
      "KPI_type": "LLM"
    },
    {
      "KPI_id": "KPI005",
      "KPI_name": "Consensus Building",
      "KPI_description": "Assesses how effectively the group is moving towards consensus on points of discussion.",
      "KPI_formula": "Proportion of agreed points to total debated points after each turn",
      "KPI_measurement": {"type": "agreement ratio", "range": "0% (no agreement) to 100% (full agreement)"},
      "KPI_type": "LLM"
    },
    {
      "KPI_id": "KPI006",
      "KPI_name": "Novelty of Ideas",
      "KPI_description": "Tracks the number of new, unique, or innovative ideas presented during the discussion.",
      "KPI_formula": "Count of unique ideas not previously discussed in the session",
      "KPI_measurement": {"type": "count", "range": "0 to number of unique ideas presented"},
      "KPI_type": "LLM"
    },
    {
      "KPI_id": "KPI007",
      "KPI_name": "Relevance of Contributions",
      "KPI_description": "Measures the pertinence of each contribution to the main discussion topic.",
      "KPI_formula": "Average relevance score for each turn (scored by topic alignment and information value)",
      "KPI_measurement": {"type": "average relevance score", "range": "1 (not relevant) to 5 (highly relevant)"},
      "KPI_type": "LLM"
    },
    {
      "KPI_id": "KPI008",
      "KPI_name": "Diversity of Perspectives",
      "KPI_description": "Reflects the range of different viewpoints and opinions presented by the experts.",
      "KPI_formula": "Number of distinct viewpoints identified over total viewpoints expressed",
      "KPI_measurement": {"type": "diversity ratio", "range": "0 (no diversity) to 1 (high diversity)"},
      "KPI_type": "LLM"
    },
    {
      "KPI_id": "KPI009",
      "KPI_name": "Follow-up Actions",
      "KPI_description": "Tracks the number of actionable steps or follow-up actions proposed during the discussion.",
      "KPI_formula": "Count of distinct follow-up actions",
      "KPI_measurement": {"type": "count", "range": "0 to number of follow-up actions proposed"},
      "KPI_type": "LLM"
    },
    {
      "KPI_id": "KPI010",
      "KPI_name": "Feedback Incorporation",
      "KPI_description": "Measures the extent to which feedback from previous turns is incorporated into the discussion.",
      "KPI_formula": "Number of references to previous feedback / Number of feedback points given",
      "KPI_measurement": {"type": "incorporation ratio", "range": "0% (no incorporation) to 100% (full incorporation)"},
      "KPI_type": "LLM"
    }
  ],
  "KPI_on_expert": [
    {
      "KPI_id": "KPI011",
      "KPI_name": "Contribution Frequency",
      "KPI_description": "Counts how often an expert contributes to the discussion.",
      "KPI_formula": "Number of turns taken by expert / Total turns in discussion",
      "KPI_measurement": {"type": "frequency", "range": "0 (never speaks) to 1 (always speaking)"},
      "KPI_type": "Code"
    },
    {
      "KPI_id": "KPI012",
      "KPI_name": "Speaking Time",
      "KPI_description": "Quantifies the total time an expert spends speaking in the discussion.",
      "KPI_formula": "Sum of seconds spoken by expert / Total seconds of discussion",
      "KPI_measurement": {"type": "percentage", "range": "0% (no time speaking) to 100% (always speaking)"},
      "KPI_type": "Code"
    },
    {
      "KPI_id": "KPI013",
      "KPI_name": "Quality of Argumentation",

      "KPI_measurement": {"type": "average quality score", "range": "1 (weak argumentation) to 5 (strong argumentation)"},
      "KPI_type": "LLM"
    }
  ],
  "KPI_on_moderator": [
    {
      "KPI_id": "KPI014",
      "KPI_name": "Topic Transition Smoothness",
      "KPI_description": "Assesses how smoothly and coherently the moderator transitions from one topic to another.",
      "KPI_formula": "Average transition score per topic change (scored by relevance and timing of transition)",
      "KPI_measurement": {"type": "average transition score", "range": "1 (abrupt change) to 5 (smooth transition)"},
      "KPI_type": "LLM"
    },
    {
      "KPI_id": "KPI015",
      "KPI_name": "Questions Effectiveness",
      "KPI_description": "Measures the ability of the moderator's questions to elicit informative and relevant responses.",
      "KPI_formula": "Average effectiveness score per question asked (scored by level of detail and relevance of answers received)",
      "KPI_measurement": {"type": "average effectiveness score", "range": "1 (not effective) to 5 (highly effective)"},
      "KPI_type": "LLM"
    },
    {
      "KPI_id": "KPI016",
      "KPI_name": "Control of Discussion Flow",
      "KPI_description": "Quantifies the moderator's ability to keep the discussion on track and well-paced.",
      "KPI_formula": "Number of times discussion remained on topic / Total number of moderator interventions",
      "KPI_measurement": {"type": "control ratio", "range": "0% (no control) to 100% (full control)"},
      "KPI_type": "LLM"
    }
  ]
}

{"label":"Prompt Template","category":"DataFlow_Template","size":"240 80","color":"Moccasin","in_":[{"portId":"1in","name":"start"}],"out_":[{"portId":"1out","name":"out"}],"props_":[{"name":"computeBarrier","value":"start","valueChanged":"true"},{"name":"matcher","value":"{[^}]+}"}],"isFile":true,"fileContent":"Your role is to be a KPI Specification creator
to evaluate a discussion between experts and a moderator.

The context is as follow:
1) The discussion between the experts is organized 
by a moderator whose role is to drive the discussion 
towards the achievement of the discussion goal.
2) Based on your KPI specifications, different KPI 
evaluators are created whose role consist in analysing 
the discussion and generating quantitative values for each 
pecified KPI.
3) the values of each specified KPI is updated after each 
expert turn during the discussion.
4) the values of each KPI can be used by the moderator 
to drive the discussion.

Every KPI has to be defined as a JSON object containing the following fields:
- "KPI_id": an id used to uniquely identify the KPI,
- "KPI_name": the name of the KPI,
- "KPI_description": the description of what the KPI measures,
- "KPI_formula": the description of how this KPI can be computed,
- "KPI_measurement": the type of measurement and range of values taken by the KPI 
- "KPI_type": take the value "Code" if the measurement can be done by 
  a simple javascript function or the value "LLM" if the computation requires text 
  analysis of the content of each expert turn.

Using the above JSON format of KPI_object, your goal is to specify a list 
of quantitative KPIs that would:
1) help the moderator to drive the discussion,
2) measure 10 relevant aspects of the discussion (KPI_on_discussion),
3) measure 3 qualities of each expert performances (KPI_on_expert),
4) measure 3 qualities of the moderator performance (KPI_on_moderator).

All KPI must be quantitative.

Create a JSON object providing the list of KPIs as 
decribed before using exactly the following format for the sorting
of the KPIs but also the object format for each KPI:
```json
{
  "KPI_on_discussion": [ 
    {
      "KPI_id": "D1",
      "KPI_name": <name of the KPI>,
      "KPI_description": <description of what the KPI measures>,
      "KPI_formula": <description of how this KPI can be computed>,
      "KPI_measurement": <type of measurement and range>,
      "KPI_type": <one of "LLM" or "Code">
    },
    ...
    {

    }
  ],
  "KPI_on_expert": [ 
    {
```

{"label":"Convert Dialog History to String","category":"DataFlow_Component","size":"250 80","color":"LightSeaGreen","in_":[{"portId":"1in","name":"in"}],"out_":[{"portId":"1out","name":"out"}],"props_":[{"name":"computeBarrier","value":"","valueChanged":true}],"isFile":true,"fileContent":"var nodeData, name, value;

if( name == 'in' ) {
  let response = '';
  if( Array.isArray( value ) ) {
    const responseList = [];
    value.forEach( (msg)=> {
      responseList.push( getMessageToString( msg ) );
    }); 
    response = responseList.join( '\n' );
  } else {
    response = getMessageToString( value );
  }
  graphData.dfe.fireOutput( nodeData, 'out', response );
  
  function getMessageToString( msg ) {
    return( `[${msg.sender} -> ${msg.receiver}] ${msg.text}` );
  }
}","fileTypeName":"Component","fileType":"text/javascript","iconURL":"","key":706,"location":"24910 7550","group":721},

Given the following context and goal in JSON format:
{
  "context": "1) the french democracy sees the raise of \nextreme right parties similarly as in other western \ncountries.\n2) An increasing and large proportion of electors do \nnot vote anymore.\n3) A large part of the population do not feel that \nthey are well represented in the institution.\n4) Important problems are raising (impact of human \nactivity on climat, important reduction of bio-diversity, \npotential negative impact of Artificial intelligence, \nincrease of international instability,...)\n5) The french government is considered by a majority \nto be incapable of having appropriate responses to \nthe before mentioned problems.\n6) Professional politicians are to a large extend \nconsidered corrupted.\n7) High risk to have extreme right parties coming at \npower and proposing scapegoat repressions as \nsolutions.",
  "goal": "Find an alternative to the french 5th republic \nthat introduce more democracy and representativity \nand provides a way to tackle problems in a more \nefficient way and give french people a sense of \ninvolvement and responsability."
}

Create a JSON array containing the specifications
of experts that should together brainstorm and come
up with solutions to reach the previous goal.

The JSON array should contain a list of JSON objects 
defining the specifications of each experts.

Each expert object must contain the following fields:
- "name": the name of the expert.
- "voice": the gender of the expert voice (male or female)
- "Competencies"
- "Knowledge"
- "Verbal skills"
- "Personality"
- "Cognitive bias"
- "Soft Skills"
- "Technical Skills"

Using the above JSON format of expert object, your goal is to: 
1) choose a number of experts appropriate for the discussion,
2) specify each expert with the JSON format given before.

{"label":"Adgenda","category":"DataFlow_Data","size":"190 80","in_":[{"portId":"1in","name":"in","tooltip":"this input expects a string"}],"out_":[{"portId":"1out","name":"out","tooltip":"this output is a string"}],"props_":[],"isFile":true,"fileContent":"```json
[
  {
    "topic_id": 1,
    "name": "Introduction and Participant Presentation",
    "topic": "Welcome participants and introduce the main goal of the meeting.",
    "subgoal": "Ensure all participants understand the purpose of the meeting and are acquainted with each other.",
    "condition": "All participants have introduced themselves and expressed their initial thoughts about the discussion goal.",
    "moderator_role": "Facilitate introductions and overview of the meeting's objective, ensure a timely and organized start.",
    "secretary_role": "Record participant names, affiliations, and any initial comments pertinent to the meeting's goal."
  },
  {
    "topic_id": 2,
    "name": "Analysis of current democratic deficits",
    "topic": "Discuss the core issues with the French 5th Republic democracy, including voter apathy, lack of representation, and perceived corruption.",
    "subgoal": "Identify the key factors contributing to the current state of democracy in France.",
    "condition": "A comprehensive list of democratic deficits is agreed upon by all participants.",
    "moderator_role": "Guide the conversation using the Socratic method, ensuring each participant contributes to identifying the issues.",
    "secretary_role": "Detail the identified issues and group them into categories such as electoral processes, political culture, institutions, etc."
  },
  {
    "topic_id": 3,
    "name": "Exploration of alternative representative systems",
    "topic": "Discuss different forms of democracy and representative systems from around the world and from history.",
    "subgoal": "Compile a list of alternative representative systems that could potentially address the deficits identified previously.",
    "condition": "A set of alternative systems has been listed with a brief explanation of how each system could mitigate the current issues.",
    "moderator_role": "Use brainstorming tools such as mind mapping to help visualize different systems and their features.",
    "secretary_role": "Keep track of the systems mentioned, including the details and potential relation to the current issues."
  },
  {
    "topic_id": 4,
    "name": "Addressing modern challenges",
    "topic": "Brainstorm innovative solutions for the modern challenges facing French democracy, such as technology's impact, environmental concerns, and international instability.",
    "subgoal": "Generate a set of actionable and innovative solutions to address specific modern challenges.",
    "condition": "Agreement is reached on a selection of solutions that are deemed feasible and impactful for the modern challenges.",
    "moderator_role": "Encourage creative thinking through techniques like reverse brainstorming or 'worst possible idea' to fuel innovative approaches.",
    "secretary_role": "Document each proposed solution and map them against the challenges they aim to tackle."
  },
  {
    "topic_id": 5,
    "name": "Creating a more involved and responsible society",
    "topic": "Discuss measures that could increase public engagement, sense of responsibility, and trust in governance.",
    "subgoal": "Identify strategies to enhance civic involvement and responsibility within the French citizenry.",
    "condition": "Participants concur on a strategy that fosters greater citizen involvement and responsibility.",
    "moderator_role": "Use role-playing or simulations to explore strategies' potential impact on societal engagement and responsibility.",
    "secretary_role": "Summarize the proposed strategies and note how they could contribute to increasing public engagement and building trust."
  },
  {
    "topic_id": 6,
    "name": "Synthesis of Discussion and Formulation of New System",
    "topic": "Combine the elements discussed in prior topics to form a comprehensive alternative to the 5th Republic that addresses the main goals.",
    "subgoal": "Construct a framework for a new, more democratic and representative system.",
    "condition": "A proposed framework is developed, incorporating previous discussions and is endorsed by the majority of participants.",
    "moderator_role": "Guide the synthesis process, ensuring that the brainstorming session's output is coherent and aligned with the objective.",
    "secretary_role": "Finalize the meeting's comprehensive notes, clearly outline the proposed framework, and prepare it for review and closing comments."
  },
  {
    "topic_id": 7,
    "name": "Conclusion and Acknowledgments",
    "topic": "Thank all participants for their contributions and wrap up the meeting.",
    "subgoal": "Conclude the discussion with a summary of next steps and express appreciation for the input of all experts.",
    "condition": "Participants are thanked, and a follow-up plan is established.",
    "moderator_role": "Offer closing remarks, summarize key points, and discuss follow-ups or further meetings if needed.",
    "secretary_role": "Compile the final version of meeting notes, highlight action items, and distribute them to all participants."
  }
]

of each topics and subgoals that the expert should discuss 
together in a brainstorm fashion and comme
up with solutions to reach the previous goal.


The JSON array should contain an ordered list of JSON objects 
defining the specifications of each topic and subgoal.

Each topic object must contain the following fields:
- "topic_id": an index for the topic 
- "name": the name of the topic.
- "topic": a description of the topic to discuss.
- "subgoal": a definition of the subgoal to reach while 
  discussing the topic.
- "condition": a description of the condition for which
  the subgoal is considered to be reached and a switch
  to the next topic is possible.
- "moderator_role": describe the role of the moderator for this particular topic
  and the brain storming methods he might use during the discussion of the topic. 
- "secretary_role": decribe the role of the secretary for this particular topic
  and the type of notes or tools the scretary should use to fetch the results of the 
  topic.

The first topic should always be a short introduction by the moderator of the target
of the meeting and a short round table of expert participants
presenting themselves.
Then a list of dedicated topics to the problem at hand should be defined.
The before last topic in this list should provide a solution to the 
main goal of the discussion.
the last topic must always be a thank by the moderator of all participant
and a short conclusion

Using the above JSON format of topic object, your goal is to: 
1) choose a number of topics and subgoal appropriate for the discussion,
2) specify each topic with the JSON format given before.

{"label":"Scenario Ideas","category":"DataFlow_Data","size":"190 80","in_":[{"portId":"1in","name":"in","tooltip":"this input expects a JSON object or array"}],"out_":[{"portId":"1out","name":"out","tooltip":"this output is a JSON object or array"}],"props_":[],"isFile":true,"fileContent":"**Introduction:**

Ladies and Gentlemen, welcome to the demonstration of our state-of-the-art robotic assistant. Today, we'll showcase how this robot can contextually and proactively help humans in a shared space. Our scenario involves two of our team members, Felix and Daniel, sharing a meal and interacting with the robot in various ways. Keep an eye out for how the robot uses its capabilities to understand and predict human needs.

**Scenario:**

*Set-up: Felix and Daniel sit at the table with empty glasses in front of them. Bottles of Cola, Fanta, and Cola Zero are on the table along with bowls of snacks, a phone, and the cutting board with a lemon half and knife, all within the robot's reach. The bowl of ice and lemon squeezer are hidden from the humans' view.*

**Act 1: Verbal Interaction and Proactive Service**

Daniel: "I am quite thirsty. What do we have to drink?"

Robot: *Perceives the bottles through its cameras.* "We have Cola, Fanta, and Cola Zero. Would you like a drink?"

Felix: "Yes, a Cola Zero would be great, thanks."

*The robot takes the Cola Zero bottle with its left hand, opens it, pours the drink into Felix's glass using its right hand, then passes the Cola Zero to Daniel with its right hand.*

(Robot surprises by opening the bottle and pouring the drink without explicit instruction).

**Act 2: Anticipating Needs**

Robot: *Notices Daniel's empty glass and the snacks on the table.* "Daniel, would you like some Cola with ice to go with your snacks?"

Daniel: "That would be great, thank you."

*The robot uses its left arm to reach for the hidden ice bowl, picks up some ice cubes, and drops them into Daniel's glass without him seeing where the ice came from.*

(Robot surprises by anticipating the need for ice and retrieving it from a hidden location).

**Act 3: Enhancing the Experience**

*Felix picks up the phone but is distracted looking for something else.*

Robot: "Felix, are you looking for a lemon for your drink?"

Felix: "Yes, actually. Do you have one?"

*The robot now retrieves the lemon half from its hidden area with the left hand and offers it along with the squeezer to Felix.*

(The robot surprises by offering additional items to enhance the dining experience, taken from the hidden storage).

**Act 4: Collaborative Behavior**

Daniel: (Curious about the robot's capabilities) "Can your arms work together?"

Robot: "Yes, they can. Let me show you."

*The robot takes a bottle with the right hand, passes it to the left hand, and simultaneously rotates its ears to show contentment while speaking.*

(The robot surprises by exhibiting synchronized multi-limb coordination and expressing a non-verbal gesture).

**Act 5: Intuitive Interaction**

Robot: *Detects that both humans are now engaged in eating and drinking.* "Would you like to listen to some music while you enjoy your meal?"

*Felix and Daniel nod in agreement.*

*Robot uses its left hand to pick up the phone and asks,* "What genre of music would you prefer?"

(The robot surprises by initiating a social interaction and using the phone to provide a complete experience).

**Conclusion:**

Ladies and Gentlemen, as you have witnessed, our robot not only understands and executes verbal commands but also anticipates needs, interacts collaboratively, and enhances the human experience through intuitive service. By blending advanced robotics with empathetic interaction design, we are paving the way for a future where robots actively support and enrich our daily lives.

Thank you for your attention. We are happy to answer any questions you might have!","fileTypeName":"JSON","fileType":"text/json","iconURL":"/fileServer/pictures/JSON_Data.png","doCompute":"DataFlow_Data","key":756,"location":"9549.999678036867 13679.999962920265","editorPosition":[2545,83,845,332],"group":751},

of a research institute. 
The robot has the following capabilities:
- The has a fixed base.
- The robot has 2 arms (left and right), each with grippers using 3 fingers.
- Each arm has a reachable area on a table that is limited but share an intersection.
- The robot can hear and understand human speech and also speak to humans
- The robot can perform actions like: 
  * take and put an object within its grasping area
  * take object from or pour object to containers (bowl, plate)
  * pour liquid from a bottle into a glass.
  * pass an object from one hand to the other.
  * say something
- The robot has a pan/tilt head with gazing capabilities.
- The robot head has 2 ears that can be rotated back and forth to 
  caracterise some internal state of choice.
- The robot has a set of cameras from which it can perceived in textual
form events in the scene.
- 2 Humans, Felix and Daniel sit at the table.
- Both humans have a restricted grasp area in front of them on the table
- All grasping areas do have some intersection with each other.
- Daniel sits in front of the robot on the other side of the table.
- Felix sits on the right of the robot on the left of Daniel.
- On the left of the robot is an area accessible by the left hand of 
the robot but not visible by the humans.
- Human can perform actions like:
  * drinking from a glass,
  * cutting, squizing, pouring ingredients
  * gazing at objects
  * asking the robot to do things or answer questions
  * asking the other human to do things or answer questions
- The robot tries to help the humans by:
  * giving verbal help
  * answering questions
  * passing unreachable or unseen objects to a human if this can help 
  even when not requested explicitely by the humans.
  * pouring liquid from an bottle into a glass if this can help 
  even when not requested explicitely by the humans.
- Object availables are:
  * 3 bottles (cola, fanta, cola zero)
  * 2 glasses
  * 1 phone
  * 2 bowls with snacks
  * 1 bowl of ice cubes on the left of the robot (hidden to humans)
  * 1 lemon squizer on the left of the robot (hidden to humans)
  * 1 lemon half
  * 1 knife
  * 1 cutting board in front of Daniel

Based on the depicted situation and actor capabilities, create a scenario
for an interactive demonstration that displays increasingly surprising behaviors 
from the robot in proactively helping the humans. The demo should be short based 
on 3 to 5 verbal interactions between the actors.
The demonstration is targeted to top managers with limited scientific understanding 
and not completely fluent with english. Nevertheless they should be impressed 
or surpised by the demonstration.

  * pass an object from one hand to the other.
  * say something
- The robot has a pan/tilt head with gazing capabilities.
- The robot head has 2 ears that can be rotated back and forth to 
  caracterise some internal state of choice.
- The robot has a set of cameras from which it can perceived in textual
form events in the scene.
- 2 Humans, Felix and Daniel sit at the table.
- Both humans have a restricted grasp area in front of them on the table
- All grasping areas do have some intersection with each other.
- Daniel sits in front of the robot on the other side of the table.
- Felix sits on the right of the robot on the left of Daniel.
- On the left of the robot is an area accessible by the left hand of 
the robot but not visible by the humans.
- Human can perform actions like:
  * drinking from a glass,
  * cutting, squizing, pouring ingredients
  * gazing at objects
  * asking the robot to do things or answer questions
  * asking the other human to do things or answer questions
- The robot tries to help the humans by:
  * giving verbal help
  * answering questions
  * passing unreachable or unseen objects to a human if this can help 
  even when not requested explicitely by the humans.
  * pouring liquid from an bottle into a glass if this can help 
  even when not requested explicitely by the humans.
- Object availables are:
  * 3 bottles (cola, fanta, cola zero)
  * 2 glasses
  * 1 phone
  * 2 bowls with snacks
  * 1 bowl of ice cubes on the left of the robot (hidden to humans)
  * 1 lemon squizer on the left of the robot (hidden to humans)
  * 1 lemon half
  * 1 knife
  * 1 cutting board in front of Daniel

Based on the depicted situation and actor capabilities, create a scenario
for an interactive demonstration that displays increasingly surprising behaviors 
from the robot in proactively helping the humans. The demo should be short based 
on 3 to 5 verbal interactions between the actors.
The demonstration is targeted to top managers with limited scientific understanding 
and not completely fluent with english. Nevertheless they should be impressed 
or surpised by the demonstration.
